result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Duane L Perkins

records.addlTxt: State's Response In Opposition to Defendant's Suppression Motion
Oral ruling on December 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

8:57 AM case called. Defendant Duane L Perkins in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Krische in court for Duane L Perkins.  Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Parties are ready to proceed. State calls Officer Wayne Bjorkman- is sworn and testifies. Record to reflect identification of the defendant by the witness. 
State offers exhibit #1- no objection from the Defense- Received and published. State offers exhibit #2- no objection from the Defense- Received. Off the record for technical difficulties. 
9:28 am back on the record. State continues direct examination. Cross-examination by the Defense. Defense asks the Court for a briefing schedule after the court listens to Exhibit #1 and Exhibit #2 in their entirety. 
Re-direct by the State. Re cross by the Defense. Witness is excused. 
Court provided with Exhibits #1 and #2 to watch in their entirety before the oral ruling. 
State to submit a brief by October 21, 2022. Defense to respond by November 11, 2022. Any response from the State is to be submitted by December 2, 2022. 
An oral ruling is scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 10:00 am (30 min, in person).
to Court from State outlining legal authority to support argument
Defendant's Motion to Suppress Statements
Motion hearing on October 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:30 AM Defendant Duane L Perkins appeared by video, in custody from the Eau Claire County Jail.  Attorney Matthew Krische in court for Duane L Perkins.  Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense would like to file a Motion to Suppress Statement by 09/23/22. 
Motion Hearing: 10/04/22 at 9am for 1 hour in person.

9:00 AM case called. Defendant Duane L Perkins in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Krische in court for Duane L Perkins.  Prosecuting attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court makes a statement before hearing argument regarding change in circumstance. Defense make an argument for modification to $5,000 cash bond with reasoning, noting defendant is invested in his defense. 
State opposes any bond modification with argument. State notes protection of the public, aggravating factors of the case and non appearances by the defendant in the past. 
Defense responds and renews their request for a $5,000 cash bond. 
Court notes there has been some change in circumstance but not significantly enough to modify bond. 
Court denies bond modification citing risk of non appearance and safety to the public. 
A status conference is already scheduled for 9/13/2022 at 9:30 AM (in person).
Defendant's Second Motion to Amend Bond
Arraignment, 05/31/2022
Motion hearing on August 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial Appearance, 04/25/2022
Status conference on September 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Case called at 11:00 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Duane L Perkins not in court- in custody in ECC Jail.  Attorney Matthew Krische appeared by video for Duane L Perkins. Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates there is a large number of discovery to review in this case and requests new date. 
Status Conference: 09/13/2022 at 9:30 AM (IN PERSON).
Status conference on July 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on June 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

(Case called at 9:35 AM) Prosecuting District Attorney Peter Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Duane L Perkins in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Krische in court for Duane L Perkins. 
Arraignment- Defense acknowledges receipt of Information, waives reading, enters Not Guilty pleas. Court receives Not Guilty pleas. 
Defense argues bond modification. State objects and makes argument. Court denies Defense's Motion for Bond modification. 
Status Conference to be set with Branch 3 Judicial Assistant.
Bail/bond hearing on May 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Amend Bond
Same as Complaint.
Arraignment on May 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 1:58 PM. Defendant Duane L Perkins in court, in custody with Attorney Matthew Krische in court for Duane L Perkins. 
Defendant waives his right to Preliminary Hearing. Attorney Tiffany Winter appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Branch 3 to schedule ARGN.
The Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender Services. Despite best efforts, the State Public Defender Office has not yet secured representation for this Defendant.

10:45 AM case called. Defendant Duane L Perkins appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Karl Schmidt. District  Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for State of Wisconsin.  
State requests a $250,000 cash bond with argument- So ordered. 
A preliminary hearing is scheduled for 5-3-22 at 2:00 PM.

Conditions:
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level if released.
Surrender passport and remain in Eau Claire County if released.
